alert.note: Alert for Newberry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 4:15PM EDT until April 05 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Edgefield, Fairfield, Lexington, McCormick, Newberry, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newberry, Batesburg-Leesville, Winnsboro, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Whitmire, Prosperity, Ridge Spring, Newberry College, Newberry County Airport, Dreher Island State Park, Blair, Jenkinsville, Monticello, Saluda County Airport, Fairfield County Airport, Blythewood and Chapin. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 between mile markers 30 and 37. Interstate 26 between mile markers 62 and 95. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
